name: Magnolia Hotel Houston

reviews.text: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Magnolia Hotel in Downtown Houston, and we were really happy with our choice.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
Good, not great
reviews.text: As veterans of the Kimpton Chain of Boutique Hotels, I would certainly rate the Magnolia Hotel as equal to the best Kimpton Hotels. The staff were very helpful and friendly, the rooms spacious and very clean, and the food at both dinner and breakfast was excellent.

We arrived after the Happy Hour from 5:30 - 6:30 PM, so we decided to eat at the bar on the 2nd floor instead of venturing outside in the rain for dinner. My wife and I were both pleasantly surprised by the food quality and exceptional service, especially by Billy working behind the bar. The morning breakfast buffet on the 2nd floor was also very good although the layout is rather odd with the buffet tables at the opposite end of the seating area. I think that it would be much more efficient to locate the buffet tables closer to the seating area - just a suggestion. The workout room is very adequate (according to my wife as I had work to do!), and the free internet access is a nice touch.
reviews.title: Meh.
Great place for a wedding
reviews.text: I would definitely stay at the Magnolia Hotel in Downtown Houston again, and I highly recommend it to both business and leisure travelers looking for an "oasis" in Downtown Houston. Give the Magnolia Hotel a try, you will not regret it!!!

If you thnk about table stakes for a good hotel, magnolias got them. What it's missing are the fine touches to make it a great hotel. Recommended improvements: change breakfast menu periodically, add windows to gym to see views, have free coffee in the lounge throughout the day, add slippers and shoe shine sponge in room, add free music channel to in room tv, have free bottled water in room, extend Internet renewal period to 24 hours, make sure switches in room turn on all lighs, make sure bulbs don't need replacing. I hope these changes are in place for my next visit. Overall, it's a good hotel, haven't tried others in the area but there is nothing at magnolia urging me to come back again - might just try one of the others to be able to compare.
reviews.title: Great alternative to chain hotels

reviews.text: Great location, small enough to care, always clean and well furnished and most importantly a happy crew, keen to please its visitors. Parking too expensive and brekfast rather pedestian though. Will be back....
reviews.title: A favourite in Houston

reviews.text: I had a very nice stay at the Magnolia hotel recently. The front desk staff were very welcoming, and the service staff were incredibly friendly and hard working. My room was in good working order, the bathroom was lovely, and internet access was easy and fast. I would absolutely stay at this property the next time I am in the area.
reviews.title: Cool, clean, beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Magnolia Hotel has quite a few things going for it: cheerful, modern decor; pleasantly sized rooms; nice bathrooms; a relaxed atmosphere; and friendly, efficient reception staff. If you normally stay in a Holiday Inn, you'll be over the moon and enjoy your stay at the Magnolia very much. But if you are used to different kind of amenities, the Magnolia disappoints. The parking is ridiculously expensive, so is the charge for wifi, the breakfast is distinctly average in quality and the atmosphere on a recent Sunday morning was a zoo with screaming kids running around, people having to eat standing up. The Magnolia is not cheap, so think about what you need and expect before choosing. It may work for you, or it may not.
reviews.title: It depends on what you expect

reviews.text: First, I want to say that the hotel has a great location, but with few parking options. Valet parking costs $24.00 per day. The hotel is nice and I have to compliment the staff, etc. Rooms were clean and the ambiance of the hotel is very good.
reviews.title: Nice Stay...but ending wasn't too great.

reviews.text: The bad part was that on our last morning, after a late evening celebrating a friend's wedding reception, we called the front desk on Sunday morning to request an extra hour or so--'late checkout'. We've always had great experiences with other hotels all over Texas and the rest of the country in permitting a late checkout. But the Magnolia's desk clerk appeared 'rude' (on the phone) and gave us a succinct answer "NO" (as in--"NO" we can't get a late checkout), and as in "NO" this is NOT negotiable. This was a surprise and really left us 'cold' on this hotel and that one desk clerk. Afterward, we discussed whether or not we would be willing to stay there again--due to this bad experience--and we haven't yet decided.
reviews.title: Elegant

reviews.text: We went to Houston for a show at the opera house and a visit to the space station. What we got was an unexpected pleasure in lodging. Leo Kahn and the outstanding valet crew, the front desk personel, breakfast buffet, workout area, pool, hot tub, dinner in the lounge, cookies and milk bar, from the time we checked in until we checked out, it was obvious that all the staff was geared to ensuring a pleasurable stay. We would recommend this hotel to anyone without reservation. Forced to come up with a complaint, it would be the amount I spent tipping for excellent service
reviews.title: Great people, great place, go back again anytime

reviews.text: Our stay was so comfortable we would have enjoyed staying a little longer. We stayed in this hotel about 2-3 years ago and the standard of quality is as good if not better than it was before. The location was convenient, rooms were well thought out, clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Freindly staff, beautiful clean rooms and convenient location.

reviews.text: We had a weekend rate that included valet, breakfast and free wi-fi for $129. We certainly got our money's worth. We enjoyed our stay. Beds were comfortable, curtains dark so the sun didn't wake you up. The lounge on the second floor was ok. We had a late after dinner drink and were the only ones there. The big screen was blaring so that was distracting. Good cocktail though. We would definately take advantage of the special rate again.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Each visit is even more magical than the previous! The staff is very accomodating and friendly. The staff in the bar is very helpful and fun! It is very easy to relax at The Magnolia! Each room, no matter where it is located is quiet and I LOVE THE BEDS!!!!
reviews.title: Magical

reviews.text: Stopped here on business - complimentary happy hour/cookies and internet use went down well! Hotel location great for downtown and service very good. Bathroom was lovely - oval bath very nice and room clean and comfortable. Staff very helpful too and linkage to local taxi firm was extremely useful for airport connections.
reviews.title: On business in Houston.

reviews.text: This is our second stay at the Magnolia Hotel in Houston. LOVE IT! It is an easy, short walk to the theater and opera district. Lots of restaurants close by. Metro rail to the Museum District just a block away. The rooms are well appointed, service excellent, great breakfast, happy hour, and nightcap gourmet cookies and milk. A definite winner!
reviews.title: Great theater/opera location!

reviews.text: Recently stayed at Magnolia one night on a business trip.
reviews.title: Great, Until I Took the Cover off the Bed

reviews.text: The good: nice, modern hotel. The rooms are definitely up to date with granite tops in the bathrooms, flat screen TVs, and overall modern furnishings. The cookie buffet in the evening was a very nice touch and the free hot breakfast in the morning was decent (not a huge selection but overall tasted good).
reviews.title: This is one of my favorite hotels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bad: I was ready to give this hotel a higher rating until I unfolded my bed sheets and found lots of black black hair all over the fitted sheet - ewwwww - and I'm a germaphobe. Realize this could have been an anomoly but this was my first and so far only stay and first impressions are a big deal. The bed was either previously slept in or the cleaning lady shed her hair all over the sheet and she didn't care.
reviews.title: Very comfortable hotel

reviews.text: Love this place, so close to so many venues and a short walk to the rail system. The extra special treats and accomodations make it unique spot. The beds are cozy, the view on the roof tp is nice and romantic at night. The apartment style rooms are super nice and if you want to throw a memorable party, rent the top floor suite.
reviews.title: great experience except for one thing: Beware of overnight loud mechanical banging noises all night from overhead.

description: This boutique hotel in downtown Houston, Texas offers accommodations for leisure travel and extended stay guests, as well as space for meetings, wedding receptions, conferences, and special events.
